{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":2992801,"name":"Elliot Scher","username":"Gandagorn","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/gandagorn/{size}/267112_2.png","created_at":"2022-01-16T16:56:50.556Z","cooked":"

Hello, I am trying to connect the ctre mag encoders to the roborio dio ports but there are two signal pins on the encoder and only one on each dio. Am I being stupid and missing something glaringly obvious here?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2022-01-16T16:56:50.556Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":457,"reads":213,"readers_count":212,"score":2327.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":400432,"topic_slug":"connect-ctre-mag-encoders-directly-to-roborio-dio-ports","display_username":"Elliot Scher","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/my-team-decided-to-have-a-swerve-drive-this-year-and-im-having-trouble-programming-it/402408/16","internal":true,"reflection":true,"title":"My team decided to have a swerve drive this year and I'm having trouble programming it","clicks":3}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":49423,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"2815A (19-23) | 190M (23...)"},"post_url":"/t/connect-ctre-mag-encoders-directly-to-roborio-dio-ports/400432/1","custom_user_title":"2815A (19-23) | 190M (23...)","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":2992803,"name":"Eli Barnett","username":"Oblarg","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/oblarg/{size}/161674_2.png","created_at":"2022-01-16T17:01:01.361Z","cooked":"

You need to use two DIO ports for each quadrature encoder. On the second port, only the signal pin will be used.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2022-01-16T17:01:01.361Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":19,"reads":211,"readers_count":210,"score":172.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":400432,"topic_slug":"connect-ctre-mag-encoders-directly-to-roborio-dio-ports","display_username":"Eli Barnett","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":12381,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Robot apartments! invisible suburbs! skeleton treasuries!"},"post_url":"/t/connect-ctre-mag-encoders-directly-to-roborio-dio-ports/400432/2","custom_user_title":"Robot apartments! invisible suburbs! skeleton treasuries!","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2992814,"name":"FrankJ","username":"FrankJ","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/frankj/{size}/5392_2.png","created_at":"2022-01-16T17:10:42.101Z","cooked":"

The quadrature part take 2 ports. The absolute part takes 1. You can use both for a total of 3 depending on your needs

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2022-01-16T17:10:42.101Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":39,"reads":211,"readers_count":210,"score":237.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":400432,"topic_slug":"connect-ctre-mag-encoders-directly-to-roborio-dio-ports","display_username":"FrankJ","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":15944,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"2974 Robot Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/connect-ctre-mag-encoders-directly-to-roborio-dio-ports/400432/3","custom_user_title":"2974 Robot Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2992828,"name":"Elliot Scher","username":"Gandagorn","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/gandagorn/{size}/267112_2.png","created_at":"2022-01-16T17:27:43.397Z","cooked":"

does anyone know where I could find a schematic for this?

This may help. For most applications, I’d recommend just going with PWM and not using the quadrature inputs.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2022-01-16T18:28:36.267Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":192,"readers_count":191,"score":58.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":400432,"topic_slug":"connect-ctre-mag-encoders-directly-to-roborio-dio-ports","display_username":"Allen Nuttle","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://github.com/Jagwires7443/SwerveSensorInterfaceBoard","internal":false,"reflection":false,"clicks":126}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":14283,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/connect-ctre-mag-encoders-directly-to-roborio-dio-ports/400432/5","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2992874,"name":"Elliot Scher","username":"Gandagorn","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/gandagorn/{size}/267112_2.png","created_at":"2022-01-16T18:32:30.541Z","cooked":"

does that mean just plugging in the encoders to pwm pins on the rio?

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2022-01-16T18:32:30.541Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":6,"reads":182,"readers_count":181,"score":71.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":400432,"topic_slug":"connect-ctre-mag-encoders-directly-to-roborio-dio-ports","display_username":"Elliot Scher","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":14283,"username":"nuttle","name":"Allen Nuttle","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nuttle/{size}/124105_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":49423,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"2815A (19-23) | 190M (23...)"},"post_url":"/t/connect-ctre-mag-encoders-directly-to-roborio-dio-ports/400432/6","custom_user_title":"2815A (19-23) | 190M (23...)","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2992892,"name":"Allen Nuttle","username":"nuttle","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nuttle/{size}/124105_2.png","created_at":"2022-01-16T19:22:25.563Z","cooked":"

No, those are PWM outputs – you want to input a PWM signal, which is done via a digital input. The paragraph in bold at the link from above gives detailed instructions and lists parts.

perfect! thanks!

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2022-01-16T20:10:29.052Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":11,"reads":155,"readers_count":154,"score":86.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":400432,"topic_slug":"connect-ctre-mag-encoders-directly-to-roborio-dio-ports","display_username":"Elliot Scher","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":14283,"username":"nuttle","name":"Allen Nuttle","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nuttle/{size}/124105_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":49423,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"2815A (19-23) | 190M (23...)"},"post_url":"/t/connect-ctre-mag-encoders-directly-to-roborio-dio-ports/400432/8","custom_user_title":"2815A (19-23) | 190M (23...)","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2998056,"name":"Michael Tucker","username":"mtuckerFRC4381","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/m/67e7ee/{size}.png","created_at":"2022-01-25T20:02:46.363Z","cooked":"

I will suggest the option that others have not.
I would avoid using a DIO port, or even two DIO ports for this use case. Because this is in the category of just because you can, doesn’t mean you should.

In the spirit of keeping it simple, purchase a Canifier CANifier - CTR Electronics and wire the encoder direct to that device. Your programmer will thank you.

Good luck

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2022-01-25T20:02:46.363Z","reply_count":3,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":8,"reads":135,"readers_count":134,"score":82.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":400432,"topic_slug":"connect-ctre-mag-encoders-directly-to-roborio-dio-ports","display_username":"Michael Tucker","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://store.ctr-electronics.com/canifier/","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"CANifier - CTR Electronics","clicks":54}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":39901,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Electronics Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/connect-ctre-mag-encoders-directly-to-roborio-dio-ports/400432/9","custom_user_title":"Electronics Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2998058,"name":"Eli Barnett","username":"Oblarg","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/oblarg/{size}/161674_2.png","created_at":"2022-01-25T20:04:40.299Z","cooked":"

This introduces nondeterministic CAN delays into the signal chain, which isn’t really great for feedback. It could be that your mechanism is slow enough that this does not matter; but you have to check.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2022-01-25T20:04:40.299Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":9,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":131,"readers_count":130,"score":51.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":400432,"topic_slug":"connect-ctre-mag-encoders-directly-to-roborio-dio-ports","display_username":"Eli Barnett","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":39901,"username":"mtuckerFRC4381","name":"Michael Tucker","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/m/67e7ee/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":12381,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Robot apartments! invisible suburbs! skeleton treasuries!"},"post_url":"/t/connect-ctre-mag-encoders-directly-to-roborio-dio-ports/400432/10","custom_user_title":"Robot apartments! invisible suburbs! skeleton treasuries!","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2998069,"name":"Ryan Blue","username":"Ryan_Blue","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ryan_blue/{size}/174016_2.png","created_at":"2022-01-25T20:22:41.518Z","cooked":"

I would say that this solution makes it more complicated. It introduces CAN delays like @Oblarg mentioned, relies on a third party library, and requires an additional piece of hardware to power and connect to the CAN bus. Connecting the encoder directly to the RoboRIO eliminates all of those concerns.

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2022-01-25T20:22:41.518Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":9,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":122,"readers_count":121,"score":29.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":400432,"topic_slug":"connect-ctre-mag-encoders-directly-to-roborio-dio-ports","display_username":"Ryan Blue","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":39901,"username":"mtuckerFRC4381","name":"Michael Tucker","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/m/67e7ee/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":29846,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"WPILib Dev | 1024 Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/connect-ctre-mag-encoders-directly-to-roborio-dio-ports/400432/11","custom_user_title":"WPILib Dev | 1024 Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2998095,"name":"FrankJ","username":"FrankJ","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/frankj/{size}/5392_2.png","created_at":"2022-01-25T20:53:38.642Z","cooked":"

We have been using DIO ports on the Rio for years for encoders. They are read by the FPGA. By far the least of our problems.

","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2022-01-25T20:53:38.642Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":9,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":117,"readers_count":116,"score":63.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":400432,"topic_slug":"connect-ctre-mag-encoders-directly-to-roborio-dio-ports","display_username":"FrankJ","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":39901,"username":"mtuckerFRC4381","name":"Michael Tucker","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/m/67e7ee/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":15944,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"2974 Robot Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/connect-ctre-mag-encoders-directly-to-roborio-dio-ports/400432/12","custom_user_title":"2974 Robot Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3012613,"name":"Santiago Sepúlveda","username":"Sepu2002","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/c67d28/{size}.png","created_at":"2022-02-24T23:43:23.280Z","cooked":"

can this be done via the breakout pads on the back of the encoders, or are we gonna have to cut and splice the encoder ribbon connectors?

","post_number":13,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2022-02-24T23:43:23.280Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":5,"reads":86,"readers_count":85,"score":52.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":400432,"topic_slug":"connect-ctre-mag-encoders-directly-to-roborio-dio-ports","display_username":"Santiago Sepúlveda","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":12381,"username":"Oblarg","name":"Eli Barnett","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/oblarg/{size}/161674_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":51602,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/connect-ctre-mag-encoders-directly-to-roborio-dio-ports/400432/13","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3012618,"name":"Ryan Blue","username":"Ryan_Blue","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ryan_blue/{size}/174016_2.png","created_at":"2022-02-24T23:53:19.316Z","cooked":"

The pads on the back of the encoders are for limit switches, so you’ll have to cut and splice the ribbon connectors, or use a breakout like this one:

vexrobotics.com

Talon SRX Encoder Breakout Board

This breakout board makes wiring a quadrature encoder or limit switch to the Talon SRX quick and easy. When connected to the Talon SRX through a ribbon cable , the breakout board provides solder pads for quadrature encoders (on the top) and limit...

Price: USD 9.99

One way to do this. Use a 10 pin ribbon cable to a Gadgeteer break out board. The break out board gives you solder pads that you can solder a PWM cable to. To use the encoder, 5 volts, 0V goes the usual places. The encoder is a 5 V device. Pin 9 is the PWM absolute signal. Pin 5 is quadature A. Pin 7 is quadature A. Pin outs is on page 5 of the manual
